name: pnp-graph-connector-python-markdown
title: Ingest local markdown content using Python
shortDescription: This sample contains a Copilot connector built in Python that shows how to ingest local markdown files. For each file, it extracts the metadata from front matter, maps them to the external connection's schema and ingests the content retaining the content and metadata. The ingested content is set to be visible to everyone in the organization.
longDescription: This sample contains a Copilot connector built in Python that shows how to ingest local markdown files. For each file, it extracts the metadata from front matter, maps them to the external connection's schema and ingests the content retaining the content and metadata. The ingested content is set to be visible to everyone in the organization.

thumbnails.alt: External content displayed in Microsoft Search search results, visualized using a custom Adaptive Card
Markdown content with front matter metadata that's ingested with the sample Copilot connector
